question: Artificial intelligence was born when Alan Turing formulated the Turing Test.
Early advances in artificial intelligence were met with skepticism and doubt.
The agent function maps percept sequences to action.
The real world is fully observable.
A taxi driving from A to B in traffic operates in a deterministic environment.
A simple reflex agent has a small but limited short-term memory.
Goal-based agents often rely on search and planning to find their goal.
A utility-based agent is better suited in the real world than a learning agent, since it is able to estimate its own utility.
Learning is necessary for complex agent behaviour to arise in a multi-agent setting.
Learning helps in a stochastic and continuous environment.
Intelligent agents are supposed to optimize their performance measure.
The vacuum world is not a toy problem.
Redundant paths in a search tree are impossible to avoid.
GRAPH-SEARCH is the same as TREE-SEARCH, only with history.
Time complexity and space complexity are the two best ways to evaluate the performance of an algorithm.
Blind search is also known as heuristic search.
A graph with branching factor b and depth d can be solved in most cases by uninformed search.
Bidirectional search reduces the time complexity with the square root.
An heuristic estimates the cheapest cost from one node to the goal node, even if the path is impossible to execute.
A* is the best known form of best-first search.
